caption.p: A literature report from 2012–2017 on chemical composition of Artemisia oils from different geographical regions (Plant part: AP: aerial parts; F: flowers; FH: flower-heads; L: leaves; B: Buds)

tr.td:
A. giraldii: β-Pinene (13.18), iso-elemicin (10.08), germacrene D (5.68), 4-terpineol (5.43), (Z)-β-ocimene (5.06).
A. subdigitata: 1, 8-Cineole (12.26), α-curcumene (10.77), β-pinene (7.38), borneol (6.23), eugenol (5.87)
S: β-Pinene (50.3), α-terpinolene (10.0), limonone (5.4), α-pinene (4.6), L: β-Pinene (36.7), α-terpinolene (6.4), limonene (4.8), β-maaliene (3.7), shyobunone (3.2), α-pinene (3.1)
L: Germacrene D (25), caryophyllene (20), alpha-zingiberene (15), borneol (11) B: 1,8-Cineole (32), camphor (16), borneol (9), caryophyllene (5)

A. ciniformis,
A. oliveriana,
A. turanica

A. ciniformis: Camphor (36.9), 1,8-cineole (20.3), trans-pinocarveol (14.7)
A. oliveriana: Borneol (9.5), eugenol (8.8), spathulenol (7.7)
A. turanica: 1,8-Cineole (37.7), α-thujone (26.7), cis-chrysanthenol (15.3)

Myrcene (8.6–22.7), cis-chrysanthenyl acetate (7.7–17.9), dihydrochamazulene isomer (5.5–11.6), germacrene D (2.4–8.0), β-thujone (0.4–7.3), linalool acetate (trace-7.0), α-phellandrene (1.0–5.3), linalool (5.3–7.0)
S: Camphor (20.3), 1,8-cineole (11.2) L: Selin-11-en-4-alpha-ol (18.6) F: Soborneol (17.1), santolina alcohol (10.6)
α-Thujone (36.35), β-thujone (9.37), germacrene D (6.32), 4-terpineol (6.31), β-caryophyllene (5.43), camphene (5.47), borneol (4.12)
Borneol (18.7 & 16.7), methyl hinokiate (11.9 & 12.9), isobornyl acetate (4.0 & 4.7), beta-gurjunene (3.8 & 4.4), caryophyllene oxide (3.7 & 4.3)

Pelor population: 1,8-Cineole (31.82) Kandovan population: Artemisia ketone (12.27), camphor (17.21), borneol (13.50), davanone D (28.44), davanone (28.88) at the 50% flowering stage Gadok population: Chrysanthenone (18.14)
Eucalyptol (11.30), camphor (8.21), terpine-4-ol (7.32), germacrene D (6.39), caryophyllene oxide (6.34), caryophyllene (5.37)
Artemisia ketone (42.1), germacrene B (8.6), borneol (6.1), cis-chrysanthenyl acetate (4.8)
Leaves: Chamazulene (30.41), β-thujone (25.75), bornan-2-one (17.33) Flowers: Chamazulene (29.9),β-thujone (19.66), camphor (16.16)

A. armeniaca: α–Pinene (10.7), nonadecane (10.0), 6,10,14-trimethyl-2-pentadecanone (9.4), spathulenol (7.8), Z-verbenol (5.8). A. incana: Camphor (20.4), 1,8-cineol (10.3), Z-verbenol (8.7), β-thujone (8.3), α-thujone (5.6)
Camphor (32.56), borneol (12.59), caryophyllene (9.6), β-pinene (9.4), β-transocimene (6.14), germacrene-D (5.34)

A. schimperi,
A. abyssinica,
A. afra,
A. absinthium

A. schimperi, A. afra, A. abyssinica: Yogomi alcohol (13.5–37.6), artemisyl acetate (12.7–35.5), artemisia ketone (2.3–13.2).
A. absinthium: Camphor (21.2–28.3), davanone (21.3–26.5)
A. absinthum (Europe): β-Thujone (42.3–66.4), chamazulene (11.3–24.2)
α-Humulene (46.3), β-caryophyllene (9.3), alpha-copaene (8.2), β-myrcene (4.3), Z(E)-alpha-farnesene (3.7), calarene (3.5)
Camphor (17.74), α-pinene (9.66), germacrene D (7.55), 1,8-cineole (7.24), β-caryophyllene (7.02), artemisia ketone (6.26)
α & β-Pinene (24.47), pseudolimonen (8.95), geranyl bromide (3.70), terpinolen (2.74), α & β-fellandrene (2.38)
1,8-Cineole (29.5), germacrene D (5.6), vulgarone B (3.1), davanone B (3.0), artedouglasia oxides (22.5: A-8.0; B-4.0; C-5.5; D-5.0)

A. aucheri: Myrcene (19.83), linalool (17.98), lavandulol (7.30), bornyl acetate (6.72), E-nerolidol (6.28), davanone (5.46), 1,8-cineole (4.51), borneol (4.38)
A. sieberi: Camphor (29.50), cis-thujone(22.58), 1,8-cineole (12.91), trans-thujone (10.60), camphene (5.05)
Eucalyptol (16.2), β-pinene (14.3), camphor (14.0), artemisia ketone (13.9), α-pinene (11.1)
Artemisia ketone (62.6), artemisia alcohol (3.7), perillene (3.1), β-caryophyllene (3.5), α-muurolol (3.5), δ-cadinene (2.1)
Artemisia ketone (6.77–29.38), trans-caryophyllene (6.22–6.94),1,8-cineole (4.75–5.13), p-cymene (7.60), yomogi alcohol (5.48)

Davanones (13.8–45.5, six oils), germacrene D (9.1–30.5, four oils), 1,8-cineole (16.4, one oil), camphor (18.9, one oil), trans-thujone (8.9 and 10.9, two oils), cis-chrysanthenyl acetate (10.4, one oil)

p-Cymene (0.6–15.2), limonene (0.1–6.3), α-pinene (0.2–10.1), β-pinene (0.4–8.9), trans-beta-ocimene (0.3–5.4), caryophyllene (4.6–13.8), germacrene D (11.5–40.3), spathulenol (4.0–11.7), caryophyllene oxide (4.3–15.6)

Hydrodistillation: Camphor (22.0), 1,8-cineole (19.3), cis-davanone (15.0), camphene (4.6), terpinene-4-ol (3.2) Microwave assisted hydrodistillation: Cis-davanone (29.8), camphor (20.8), 1,8-cineole (13.8), geranyl acetate (5.7), terpinene-4-ol (3.0)

A. monosperma,
A. scoparia,
A. judaica,
A. sieberi

A. sieberi and A. judaica: Spathulenol 30.42 and 28.41, resp.)
A. monosperma: Butanoic acid (17.87)
A. scoparia: Acenaphthene (83.23)
β-Thujone (33.78), germacrene-D (9.31), β-thujone (6.01), caryophyllene (5.86), caryophyllene oxide (6.17), borneol (2.16)
Camphor (19.0), E-caryophyllene (9.3), eucalyptol (6.8), germacrene D (6.7), α-cadinol(6.5)
